What does the `getlocalsolps` command do in Verus?
The `getlocalsolps` command returns the average local solutions per second since this node was started.

### `getlocalsolps`
Returns the average local solutions per second since this node was started.
This is the same information shown on the metrics screen (if enabled).#### Result:
xxx.xxxxx   (numeric) Solutions per second average
What is the format of the result returned by the `getlocalsolps` command?
The result returned by the `getlocalsolps` command is a numeric value representing the average solutions per second, in the format `xxx.xxxxx`.

### `getlocalsolps`
Returns the average local solutions per second since this node was started.
This is the same information shown on the metrics screen (if enabled).#### Result:
xxx.xxxxx   (numeric) Solutions per second average
Is there another way to view the information provided by the `getlocalsolps` command?
Yes, the same information is also shown on the metrics screen if it is enabled.

### `getlocalsolps`
Returns the average local solutions per second since this node was started.
This is the same information shown on the metrics screen (if enabled).#### Result:
xxx.xxxxx   (numeric) Solutions per second average
